question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory improve in the coming week as per Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory improve in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's predictions?
para_P.body:

para_P.body:

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prohibition must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal paperwork, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It exclusively concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prohibited from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prohibited from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It specifically relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification or be barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) as a result of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or trustworthy media outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for a resolution.

The question will be marked "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It specifically pertains to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if an official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made prior to the market's closing on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if an official announcement about Joe Biden's death occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden stays in office as the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will remain in the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden remains in his role as the President of the United States through to the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES outcome, as the Acting President is not recognized as the President by the Constitution.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday and remain President through the end of July 2024?
question.body: Resolves YES if both of the following occur: (a) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO otherwise. Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not impact the resolution as long as he remains President.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away before Saturday and still hold the position of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered a YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's demise is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET). It will be deemed a NO in all other cases. Note: A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not affect the outcome as long as he remains in the role of President.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Joe Biden to pass away prior to Saturday and still hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body: This resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met: (a) An official declaration of Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET). It resolves to NO in all other cases. Note: A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment does not affect the resolution as long as he is still President.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden die before Saturday yet remain in office until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This will be considered TRUE if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (a) An official announcement of Joe Biden's death occurs before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, and (b) Biden remains in his role as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). It will be deemed FALSE in all other scenarios. Note: A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment does not influence the outcome as long as he is still recognized as President.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media coverage. Speculative statements, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be barred or excluded from appearing on the primary election ballot in any state of the U.S. for a federal office as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or exclusion must be confirmed through official statements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative remarks, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and then later reinstated, leading to him not being barred or excluded from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

This question is not concerned with who holds the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from any U.S. state's primary election ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if both of the following conditions are met:

1. As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

2. Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. 

The question will resolve as "No" if either or both of these conditions are not met.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: In the event that Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If he does not, the market will conclude with a no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to proceed in the election before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

para_P.title: Could Biden exit the election before July 20?
para_P.body: If Biden chooses to step back or is unable to continue in the election before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will end with a yes. Otherwise, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden drops out of the race before July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This condition will be met if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, or a consensus of credible reporting.

(b) This condition will be met if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be fulfilled if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, or a consensus of reliable news reporting.

(b) This will be fulfilled if Biden either withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (a) Kamala Harris is appointed as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This requirement will be satisfied if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for determining this will be official announcements from the US government, or a consensus of reliable news reports.

(b) This requirement will be fulfilled if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

para_P.title: Could it occur that both of the following situations take place: (a) Kamala Harris is designated as President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and (b) Biden steps down from the race before July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be met if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially acknowledged as President or Acting President of the United States at any point prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary basis for this determination will be official declarations from the US government, or a consensus of trustworthy news sources.

(b) This condition will be satisfied if Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapable of continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating an initiative to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially intended, arguing that this suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the movement.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues are still quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also satisfy this market's criteria for a YES resolution. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market closure, this market will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Background from Politico:

Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman commented in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party by the conclusion of the market on Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, if multiple such statements with a total of 20 lawmakers’ endorsements are presented, it would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be satisfied by the market closure, this market will resolve as NO.

para_P.body:

A number of House Democrats are collaborating on a plan to express their dissent against their party's efforts to expedite President Joe Biden's nomination ahead of the original schedule, arguing that it stifles the lively ongoing debate regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever strategy to end the discussion, and I guess through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm the letter's existence.

Moreover, if several such statements with a cumulative total of 20 lawmakers’ endorsements are presented, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early AND will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if both of the following conditions are met:

1. A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st. This includes multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures.

2. 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, as confirmed by the New York Times source.

If both conditions are met, the question resolves to YES. If either or both conditions are not met, the question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden early AND will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied:

1. By the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st, at least 20 members from the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party have signed a public statement opposing the early nomination initiative. This can include several letters that collectively have a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers.

2. At least 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to step aside at any time prior to midnight on July 20 Central Time, as reported by the New York Times.

If both criteria are fulfilled, the answer will be YES. If either or both criteria are not fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

2. At any time prior to midnight on July 20 Central Time, 10 or more Democratic Senators must publicly call for Biden to step aside, as verified by the New York Times.

If both of these criteria are satisfied, the answer will be YES. If either or both are not satisfied, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Standings at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will have a positive resolution if the United States Olympic Team is the sole highest ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be deemed ambiguous if the Paris Olympics do not occur before the year 2027. It will result in a negative outcome if any other team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.body:

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they have given up on Biden's chances for victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are various drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals knowledgeable about the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if at least five named Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collaborate to ask Joe Biden to think about ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of a letter similar to what has been reported, or it could involve a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is necessary for all five individuals to be part of the same collective message. If five individuals separately express to journalists that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden asking him to step aside will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are mentioned but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators will pressure Biden to drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) A group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This can be through signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats must have at least 5 qualifying names made public before the deadline. Ambiguities will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must make a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

The combined question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as specified.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) A coalition of at least 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators will urge Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A coalition comprising at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must collaborate to request Joe Biden to contemplate concluding his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This can involve signing a letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person. All five individuals must convey the same group message. Five individuals individually informing reporters that they believe Biden should step aside is inadequate. Reports regarding unnamed Democrats must disclose at least 5 qualifying names publicly before the deadline. Any uncertainties will default to resolving NO. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this condition resolves NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election. The announcement must be unequivocal and final, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made before the deadline, this condition resolves NO.

The overall question resolves YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will take place: (a) A collective of at least five identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will call on Biden to withdraw prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A collective of no fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators must collaborate to request that Joe Biden contemplate ceasing his 2024 re-election efforts, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be executed through signing a letter or another method such as a group discussion with Biden in person. All five individuals must convey a unified message together. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden ought to step aside is inadequate. If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this aspect resolves to NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must issue a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will neither seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unequivocal and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made before the specified deadline, this aspect resolves to NO.

The overall question resolves to YES only if both (a) and (b) occur as outlined.

para_P.title: Could it happen that both of the following events occur: (a) A group of at least five named Democratic House Representatives or US Senators will urge Biden to step back before July 20, 2024, and (b) Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) A group consisting of no fewer than five specified Democratic Party US House Representatives or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to motivate him to do so, before Saturday, July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be accomplished through signing a letter or another means such as a face-to-face discussion with Biden. All five must convey a single, coordinated message. Merely having five individuals express to reporters that they think Biden should withdraw is insufficient. If these criteria are not met before July 20, this part will resolve to NO.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign must release a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will neither pursue nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The declaration must be explicit and final, leaving no room for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the specified deadline, this part will resolve to NO.

The overall question will resolve to YES only if both (a) and (b) happen as described.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" in this context means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution as long as more than 50% of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to everyone in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) can be accessed by the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it cannot.

In this context, "accessible to everyone" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as experienced in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome as long as more than 50% of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome even if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be available to all individuals in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question receives a response of **YES** if the general public in the EU can utilize [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not possible.

In this scenario, "available to all individuals" implies that the typical condition for people in the EU is that they can use it without the need for a VPN (although it might require payment). If it is not obtainable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to particular demographics (like minors), it will still be deemed a favorable result as long as over 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" denotes the regular web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be viewed as a positive outcome even if the name or website undergoes changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (permitting users to enter queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (2) the linked market get at least 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(1) The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) Resolves YES if the market embedded above has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (2) the specified market will have no fewer than 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring a payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to (for instance) minors, it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) This will resolve as YES if the market mentioned above has 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve as NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024, and (2) the associated market will have no fewer than 377 traders by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or is restricted for certain groups (like minors), it can still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) It will resolve to YES if the market mentioned above has at least 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) OpenAI's ChatGPT will be broadly available in the European Union by June 30, 2024, and (2) there will be at least 377 traders in the related market by the end of July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The response will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Broadly available" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (although it might require payment). If it is unavailable in certain EU countries (as observed in Italy in early 2023), or is limited for specific demographics (like minors), it can still resolve positively, given that over 50% of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" specifically refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(2) It will resolve to YES if the aforementioned market has a minimum of 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will resolve to NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia set to advance to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will Latvia progress to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This question will result in a **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is later verified by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having moved on to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. On the other hand, if Latvia does not qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will both Latvia and Belgium qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both Latvia and Belgium participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Latvia or Belgium does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if both Latvia and Belgium take part in a Semi-final and are confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Latvia or Belgium does not qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or the absence of Russian control over the area.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be considered Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign puts forth a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If no such clear statement is made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its outcome will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the result is known and clear. Feel free to message @jskf to request early resolution or report any issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024 regarding his decision not to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the presidency?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This inquiry will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public announcement stating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should not allow for any interpretation that Biden might consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with No.

Further details and background information can be accessed on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed reliable are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

Additional details and background information are available on Metaculus.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party anticipated?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: Will there be a subsequent debate for the Democratic party?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic contenders (including Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 (b) There is another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to happen: (a) at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign before July 20, and (b) another debate among Democratic presidential candidates takes place?
para_P.body:
(a) Source for resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators by midnight July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

(b) This will be marked as YES if a debate occurs among potential Democratic contenders (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Otherwise, it will be marked as NO.

para_P.body:
(a) Reference link: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

(b) This will be recorded as YES if a debate happens among possible Democratic contenders (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be recorded as NO otherwise.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in the roster of qualified presidential candidates endorsed by Iran's Guardian Council for the upcoming presidential election.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and will Iran's Guardian Council include Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name on its list of approved candidates for president of Iran?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is included in Iran's Guardian Council's list of qualified presidential candidates for the upcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad be listed among the approved presidential candidates by Iran's Guardian Council?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges indicating that an assault attributed to Israel within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the Guardian Council of Iran's roster of eligible candidates for the forthcoming presidential election.

para_P.title: Will there be a lethal strike by Israel inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024, and will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's name appear on the Guardian Council's list of sanctioned presidential candidates in Iran?
para_P.body: This question will resolve to **Yes** if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) After the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible sources report that an assault attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad is listed among the approved candidates for the presidency by Iran's Guardian Council in the forthcoming election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, and will Mahmoud Ahmadinejad be included in the Guardian Council's approved list of presidential candidates in Iran?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Following the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, reliable sources indicate that an attack attributed to Israel has taken place in Iran, resulting in the fatalities of at least five individuals. (2) Mahmoud Ahmadinejad appears on the list of sanctioned candidates for the presidency provided by Iran's Guardian Council for the upcoming election.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) remain in the hands of the Republican Party during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official source or statement from Ohio State will be utilized. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

para_P.title: Will Ohio's 6th congressional district, formerly represented by Bill Johnson, be kept by the Republican Party in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from widely recognized sources, an official Ohio State source or announcement will be referenced. If no election occurs prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

para_P.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district, which was previously held by Bill Johnson, in the upcoming special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered in the affirmative if credible sources confirm that a Republican candidate has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of contradictory information from well-known sources, an official statement from Ohio State will be used as reference. Should there be no election before January 1, 2025, this question will become invalid.

question.body: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle, with the announcement being definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive, and (b) a person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district, as reported by credible sources, or if popular sources disagree, as confirmed by an Ohio State source or statement, with the election held before January 1, 2025. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to additional candidates that may emerge later.

For this inquiry, the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the outcome is solely based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).
