question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Will Rishi Sunak not be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry resolves as **Yes** if, for any reason, Rishi Sunak does not secure election as a Member of Parliament during the UK general election on July 4, 2024.

Should Sunak be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is a candidate (if he is running in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is Rishi Sunak going to lose his bid for election in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak successfully becomes a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this inquiry will conclude as **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official declaration from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is standing as a candidate (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to win his election campaign in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if Rishi Sunak fails to obtain a seat as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election set for July 4, 2024.

On the other hand, if Sunak manages to secure a position as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4, 2024 UK general election, the answer to this question will be **No**.

The outcome must be based on [reliable](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news outlets, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (assuming he is a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will fail to be elected if he is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election, for any reason. Credible media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate will be used for resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that both the following events will take place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican candidate if he is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, rather than by the announcement made on the election day itself.

(b) Rishi Sunak will not win if he does not secure a position as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024, regardless of the reasons. The outcome will be determined based on reliable media reports or an official declaration from the returning officer in Sunak's constituency.

para_P.title: Are the following two events both set to happen: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will become the Republican candidate if he is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not dependent on who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will not win a seat if he is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. Reliable media reports or an official statement from the returning officer in Sunak's constituency will be used to determine the outcome.

para_P.title: Will both of these events occur: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Rishi Sunak fails to secure a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Vivek Ramaswamy will be the Republican nominee if the Republican National Convention delegates choose him as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made by the convention delegates and is not influenced by who is declared as the nominee on the date of the 2024 US election.

(b) Rishi Sunak will not secure a seat if he is not elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election on July 4, 2024, for any reason. The determination will be based on trustworthy media reports or an official announcement from the returning officer in Sunak's constituency.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identifiable Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two secure-seat members have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Two of the most vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they’ve already dismissed Biden’s chances for a victory in November.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one would request that Biden conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identifiable Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur by signing a letter as mentioned above, but it could also take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and jointly requesting that he withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In any uncertain cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of them would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five individuals who are aware of these efforts.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaboratively solicit Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could take the form of signing a letter as mentioned above, or it could manifest in other ways, such as a group engaging with Biden directly and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports regarding any number of unnamed Democrats appealing to Biden to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's closing date. In cases of uncertainty where such names are reported but not confirmed with sufficient certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.body:

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more tumultuous. Different drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of them would ask Biden to end his campaign, according to five sources familiar with these initiatives.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators jointly request Joe Biden to consider terminating his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter as previously mentioned, or it could occur through other means, such as a group directly engaging with Biden and collectively asking him to withdraw.

It is crucial that all five individuals are part of the same unified message. If five individuals independently tell reporters that they think Biden should withdraw, that will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports concerning any number of unnamed Democrats appealing to Biden to step aside will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In situations of uncertainty where such names are reported but not confirmed with enough certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not met before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

This could occur through signing a letter or another method, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw. para_P.body:

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden stays in the position of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to stay in office as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer is YES if Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (ET); the answer is NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Can Biden remain in his role as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The response is YES if Biden remains in his position as the President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); the response is NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (such as designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES response. (An Acting President is different from a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Important: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that on July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded from the primary election ballot for any federal office in the U.S. under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot for any U.S. state regarding a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen *after* the specified date. It solely relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump potentially be barred from the primary election ballot for any federal position in the U.S. due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a "Yes" answer if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally barred or prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) as a result of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or prohibition must be confirmed through official communications from state authorities, court decisions, legal documentation, or trustworthy news outlets. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial declarations will not suffice for resolution.

The question will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the described criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden remains President through end of July 2024 (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

(b) Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Resolves NO if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Biden continues as President until the end of July 2024 (b) Trump is either removed or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This resolves to YES if Biden is still the U.S. President at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is distinct from a President as per the Constitution).

(b) This resolves to YES if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This removal or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial communications will not be adequate for resolution. It resolves to NO if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. The question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might take place after the specified date. It strictly addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then later reinstated, leading to him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that (a) Biden will still be President at the end of July 2024 and (b) Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if Biden is still in the position of U.S. President by the conclusion of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that time. A temporary power shift under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (Acting President is not the same as President as per the Constitution).

(b) Resolves YES if, as of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or barring must be validated through official state government announcements, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. Resolves NO if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. The inquiry does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might happen after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot by July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President by the end of July 2024, and will Donald Trump be disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot for any federal position in the U.S. as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This question resolves with a YES if Biden continues to hold the office of U.S. President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves with a NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (for instance, appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not considered the same as the President according to the Constitution.

(b) This question resolves with a YES if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (such as President, Senate, or House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative writings, opinion articles, or unofficial claims will not suffice for resolution. It resolves with a NO if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024. The inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent changes that may occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified conditions as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot by July 15th, the question resolves negatively.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value for that date shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than 3 as per the national polling average from 538 on July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the size of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as represented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive number of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not released before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement by July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce publicly by July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign provides a clear and official public declaration stating that he will not seek or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** result, the announcement must be direct and unambiguous: it must remove any chance that Biden could accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following events will take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden will be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and does not exceed 3 points on July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 2 and at most 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not take the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 2 and no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average, and (b) Joe Biden will publicly announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not seek the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will receive a **Yes** if, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is more than 2 and at most 3 points on July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative number means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will receive a **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal, leaving no room for interpretation that Biden would consider accepting the nomination.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden, according to the same FiveThirtyEight forecast for July 19, 2024. Should both candidates possess identical probabilities, the market will resolve at a 50-50 outcome.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any adjustments in the methodology utilized by FiveThirtyEight to compute its statistics will not influence the outcome of this market.

The resolution will be based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. This market may remain unresolved until the data for July 20 is provided. In the event that no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a figure out of 100, rounded to one decimal point (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement by July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement declaring that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** determination, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce publicly before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered **Yes** if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a definitive and official public statement confirming that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for a new term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** result, the statement must be unequivocal: it should remove any uncertainty regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the US President at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (The Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution)

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (The Acting President is considered separate from the President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than an unnamed Democrat, will his support among Manifold respondents increase by at least 3%?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls that will conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other inquires about their choice of a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat included in the hypothetical polling either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the views of Manifold respondents reflective of the broader public?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are either leading or within the error margin. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the broader population?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump run against Joe Biden instead of a conventional Democrat, can we expect him to secure a minimum of a 3% advantage among Manifold voters?
para_P.body:
Two surveys conducted by Manifold will conclude on July 6. One survey asks Manifold participants to vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests them to vote with a typical Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump by a margin that exceeds the margin of error, while all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are either ahead or within the margin of error. Do the responses from Manifold participants represent the general population?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote share in the first survey exceeds that in the second survey by 3% or more at the close of both surveys.

Trump's vote percentage is calculated as (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Others)). The outcome will be YES if the difference between the calculation for poll 1 and that for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the result will be NO.

The surveys and this question will never resolve as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time, regardless of the situation.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which represents a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value was Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 3 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved by measuring the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates Biden is in the lead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which is represented as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.body:

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden is the opponent rather than a typical Democrat, will Trump receive a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls that will close on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to vote for Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in this hypothetical scenario either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Will Trump secure a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both set to conclude on July 6. One poll presents a hypothetical scenario where respondents vote for Joe Biden, while the other offers a choice between a generic Democrat.

Public sentiment surveys regularly indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats in hypothetical matchups are either ahead or within the margin of error. Do Manifold respondents reflect the broader population?

This market will determine a YES outcome if Trump's vote share in the first poll surpasses that in the second by 3% or more at the time of closure for both polls.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result will be YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not conclude as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Will Trump gain at least 3% additional backing from Manifold participants when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat?
para_P.body:
There are two polls conducted by Manifold, both set to finish on July 6. One poll asks respondents to choose Joe Biden, while the other presents a choice involving a generic Democrat.

Public opinion polls consistently show that Joe Biden lags behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas other Democrats in similar scenarios are either leading or within the margin of error. Do respondents from Manifold represent the general population?

This market will yield a YES result if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To determine the percentage of votes for Trump, the calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome will be YES if the difference between the calculations for poll 1 and poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this question will remain open until the specified closing time, without being marked as N/A, regardless of the situation.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump give testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the purported "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden vs a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One poll includes Joe Biden and the other a generic Democrat. This resolves YES if Trump's votes in poll 1 exceed poll 2 by 3% or more, based on the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). Otherwise, NO.

(b) This resolves YES if credible sources report Trump has testified, in person or remotely, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

(b) This will be considered TRUE if reliable sources indicate that Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.body:
(a) Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll features Joe Biden while the other includes a generic Democrat. If not, it will be marked as NO.

(b) This will be marked as YES if reliable sources indicate that Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the trial regarding "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will the following two occurrences take place: (a) Trump sees an increase of at least 3% in support from Manifold participants compared to Biden and a generic Democrat, (b) Trump testifies at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls closing on July 6. One includes Joe Biden and the other features a generic Democrat. This will be recorded as YES if Trump's percentage in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more, calculated using the formula: (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If this condition is not met, it will be recorded as NO.

(b) This will be recorded as YES if credible sources confirm that Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or virtually, at the trial concerning "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Ted Cruz going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included later on.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is solely based on who the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention) select.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024 stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This question will resolve the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and public announcement indicating that he will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For the resolution to be Yes, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be affirmed with a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate entity) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A Republican lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed with a YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not relevant to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A Republican legislator is urging Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) The Core CPI in the US rises by more than 0.1% from June to July 2024 (b) Biden is officially deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The resolution will rely on the data found at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will consider the exact (not rounded) figure.

(b) Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to activate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) An increase of over 0.1% in the Month-over-Month US Core CPI for July 2024 (b) A declaration of Biden's incapacity under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% when compared to June 2024. The resolution data will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

(b) This will be considered YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question. Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not qualify. Additionally, Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: Could both of the following events occur: (a) A rise exceeding 0.1% in the Month-over-Month US Core CPI for July 2024 (b) An announcement of Biden's inability to serve under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 reports an increase greater than 0.1% relative to June 2024. The data will be obtained from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) figure.

(b) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant body), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this inquiry. Biden's exit from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Additionally, Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not relevant.
