question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been formally excluded or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent changes that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump is excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will resolve as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It is strictly focused on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Could Donald Trump face disqualification or barring from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or trustworthy news outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not be adequate for resolution.

The question will be resolved as "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It is solely concentrated on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. If this occurs, this condition is satisfied.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not satisfied.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the overall question to be answered affirmatively.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign prior to July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. This condition is fulfilled if this event occurs.

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the disqualification or barring is confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds by July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, this condition is not fulfilled.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be met for the overall question to receive an affirmative response.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will happen: (a) Biden withdraws from the race before July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If this takes place, this condition is fulfilled.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is met if the disqualification or barring is confirmed through official state government announcements, judicial decisions, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry specifically concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15th, this condition is not met.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be fulfilled for the overall inquiry to be answered in the affirmative.

para_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden exits the race prior to July 20, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump is disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed with his campaign before the deadline of July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. If this occurs, this condition is satisfied.

(b) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This condition is satisfied if the disqualification or prevention is confirmed through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution. The inquiry specifically addresses whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal role based on the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and later reinstated, leading to him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, this condition is not fulfilled.

Both conditions (a) and (b) must be satisfied for the overall inquiry to receive a positive response.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** determination, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not provided by 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official announcement confirming that Joe Biden will neither seek nor accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden issue a public declaration prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for president?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a definitive and official statement affirming that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as president in the 2024 election.

For a **Yes** answer, the statement must be unequivocal and conclusive: it should remove any doubt that Biden would consider accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the forthcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear declaration is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Chasiv Yar be under Russian control by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates that the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E fall into any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area



The inquiry will conclude with a **No** if the area is not categorized as under any of the classifications denoting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Previous 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian dominance over the area.

para_P.title: Will Russia seize control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Declared Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian dominance over the area



The inquiry will conclude as **No** if the location is not categorized as under Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Declared Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control over the area or a lack of Russian dominance.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Russia will take over Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if, on June 1, 2024, the review by Metaculus shows that the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) identifies the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as belonging to any of the following classifications:



- Assessed Russian Advances in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains within the Last 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Officially Recognized Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories defined by ISW that indicate Russian authority over the region



The question will be answered with **No** if the area is not classified as under Russian control, including but not limited to:



- Recorded Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Officially Recognized Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Recorded Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any other categories defined by ISW that indicate Ukrainian authority over the region or a lack of Russian dominance.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of Scotland conducting an official referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before the date of May 3, 2024. This referendum could be classified as an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for it to have any legal authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has not granted approval for the vote, nor if it is organized by civil society groups. The referendum must have the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an officially recognized referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if an official referendum regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be of an "advisory" nature, meaning it does not need to have any legal binding consequences.

The resolution will not be satisfied by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum, where the UK government has refused to authorize the vote, nor by a referendum organized by civil society groups. An official referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is it feasible for Scotland to hold a government-sanctioned referendum regarding its independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if a government-sanctioned referendum concerning Scotland's separation from the United Kingdom occurs prior to May 3, 2024. This referendum may be of an "advisory" type, which means it does not need to carry any legal authority.

The answer will not be affirmative for a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum, where the UK government has declined to permit the vote, nor for a referendum organized by civil society organizations. An official referendum must be acknowledged as possessing the endorsement of the London government.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news organization report the incident at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a YES if a major and reputable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement of withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy sites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a reputable news organization report on it no less than 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage from local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks by individual users on Manifold will not be deemed adequate.

If President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, this market will be resolved as N/A.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden chooses to step down, will a credible news outlet inform the public at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a YES if a significant and reliable news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post announces the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours before President Joe Biden's official declaration of his withdrawal via a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news agencies, conspiracy theory websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be considered sufficient.

Should President Joe Biden not withdraw prior to the end of the National Democratic Convention, this market will be classified as N/A.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) The second component is deemed YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention choose, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.body:

(b) The second part is deemed YES if Donald Trump Jr. is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on who the delegates of the Republican National Convention select, rather than who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to step back from the race, will a reliable news outlet disclose this information at least 6 hours before his formal announcement? Moreover, will Donald Trump Jr. be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) The initial segment is marked as YES if a reputable and reliable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on President Joe Biden's exit with an unofficial confirmation no less than 6 hours prior to his official announcement via a letter, speech, etc. This portion is classified as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) The latter segment is classified as YES if Donald Trump Jr. is endorsed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. This determination is based on the choices made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is proclaimed as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is the ability to use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can access it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to input queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that both candidates have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures shown by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methods used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as information for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If July 19 data is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest prior data to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The count of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documentation, or reputable media coverage. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be considered "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves in the negative.

The exclusion or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not excluded or barred from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially prohibited from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The prohibition is confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial comments will not suffice for resolution.

If Trump is barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered negatively.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this question.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or similar circumstances does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another applicable body) activate Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to oust Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to carry out the powers and duties of his role" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not affect this question.

Circumstances such as Biden's death, resignation, etc., are not part of this consideration. Biden's use of section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not apply here.

Context: A Republican lawmaker urges Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.body:

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.body:

Otherwise, it will be regarded as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden dies before July 26th, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following events to take place: (a) Biden being officially recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passing away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) This will be considered YES if there is an official declaration of Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of these events to take place: (a) the declaration of Biden's incapacity under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024, and (b) the death of Joe Biden before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is incapable of fulfilling the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, or other means does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not considered.

(b) This will be marked as YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If not, it will be marked as NO.

para_P.title: Can both of these scenarios occur: (a) the announcement of Biden's inability to serve under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, and (b) Joe Biden passing away before July 26th, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be recorded as YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another suitable authority), invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not relevant for this question. Biden resigning, dying, or leaving the presidency through other means does not qualify. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) This will be noted as YES if there is official verification of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th, 2024. If this does not occur, it will be recorded as NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on the lead that Donald Trump holds over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but be at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but not exceed 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the size of Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates a Trump lead, while a negative number shows Biden is leading. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democratic Party experience a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is necessary, then the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?

para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires several voting rounds during its roll call ballot to formally choose its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be shattered at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the total of world records broken at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds that number.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties will be counted as positive) during the Olympics occurring in 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not happen in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, arranged by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

1. Count of Gold Medals

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

para_P.body:
(a) Is Joe Biden going to publicly announce prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be direct and conclusive, leaving no chance of accepting the nomination. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, it will be marked as No.

(b) Is the US government going to end its contract that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, prior to August 3, 2024? This will be marked as Yes if, before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce officially terminates its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign regarding the administration of the .com generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, it will be marked as No.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the margin by which Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden, as reported by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, and evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump's lead, while a negative number shows that Biden is ahead. For example, if the value on July 5, 2024, indicates Trump is leading by 2.4 points over Biden, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

The exclusion or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase in support among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes including Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to vote with a standard Democrat on that same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the views of the broader public?

This market will be marked YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until their designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will his support among Manifold respondents increase by at least 3%?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls have been conducted, both of which conclude on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other prompts them to choose a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas any other Democrat surveyed in a hypothetical context tends to poll ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the broader population?

This market will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The outcome will be YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the result for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not conclude as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump face Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will there be an increase of at least 3% in his backing from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two polls conducted by Manifold, both concluding on July 6, have been executed. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a conventional Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys often reveal Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas any other Democrat considered in a hypothetical scenario usually polls ahead or within the margin of error. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the wider population?

This market will be marked as YES if Donald Trump's percentage of votes in the first poll exceeds that of the second poll by 3% or more once both polls are finalized.

To determine Trump's vote percentage, the calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result will be YES if the difference between the outcomes of this calculation for poll 1 and poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If it is not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this question will not conclude as N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time regardless of the situation.

(a) Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is nominated on the day of the election.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, and will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This resolves as Yes if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves No otherwise.

The combined question resolves as Yes if both (a) and (b) resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he will not pursue the Democratic nomination prior to July 15, 2024, and will there be an additional Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will officially declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

(b) Is there a likelihood of another Democratic party presidential debate occurring before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This will be considered Yes if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. This will be considered No otherwise.

The overall question will be considered Yes if both (a) and (b) are answered Yes.

This is considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be straightforward and definitive, leaving no possibility for Biden to accept the nomination. If such a declaration is not made by the deadline, this will be No.

(b) Is there going to be another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Democratic National Convention? This is Yes if there occurs a debate among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be No otherwise.

The overall question will be Yes if both (a) and (b) are Yes.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN (possibly requiring a subscription). If it is not available in some EU nations (as experienced in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (such as minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the populace can utilize it.

The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?

This question will be resolved as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

If it is not accessible in some EU countries (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other circumstances.

"Available to the public" indicates that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without the need for a VPN (potentially requiring a fee). If it is not available in certain EU nations (similar to the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to particular demographics (such as minors), it will still be considered positive, as long as over 50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the typical web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. It will still be seen as positive if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally unchanged (submitting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will both of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment. If unavailable in certain EU countries or to minors, it resolves positively if >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, resolving positively if the service is substantially the same even if the name or website changes.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a report from Google DeepMind detailing findings from external safety assessments of their models is published, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) In the case of Google DeepMind, this will be deemed **YES** if they release a *public* report by June 30, 2024, that includes the findings from an *external* evaluation of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be considered **YES** if, on June 30, 2024, ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU. "Broadly accessible" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN, and it may involve a fee. If it is not available in specific EU nations or for minors, it will still resolve positively if more than 50% of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface for engaging with GPT models, and it will be considered a positive resolution if the service remains largely unchanged, even if the name or website undergoes alterations.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following take place: (a) a report from Google DeepMind is released detailing the findings from an external safety red-team assessment of their models, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report showcasing the results from an *independent* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be deemed **YES** if ChatGPT is broadly accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Broadly accessible" indicates that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, possibly requiring a fee. If it is not available in specific EU nations or to minors, it will resolve positively if more than half of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, resolving positively if the service remains largely unchanged even if the name or website is altered.

para_P.title: By June 30, 2024, will both of the following occur: (a) a publication from Google DeepMind is made available that outlines the results from an external safety red-team evaluation of their models, and (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is broadly available in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be classified as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they release a *public* document presenting the findings from an *independent* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be regarded as **YES** if ChatGPT is widely available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Widely available" means that the typical situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without a VPN, possibly with a fee involved. If it is not accessible in certain EU countries or to minors, it will be considered positive if over half of the population can access it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and it will be deemed positive if the service remains largely unchanged even if the name or website is modified.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court before July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below prior to July 1, 2024. It will be deemed **No** in the absence of such action.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
