* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident happening in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or death to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the date of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the date of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The resolution will be No if this does not occur.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any authority of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the Summer Olympics of 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) causes injury and/or results in the death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), at any time from the Opening Ceremony date (26 July 2024) to the Closing Ceremony date (11 August 2024). Conversely, the response will be negative if the aforementioned situation does not occur.

An incident will be categorized as a 'terrorist incident' if it is labeled as such by any official body of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Could a terrorist event occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question will receive an affirmative response if a terrorist event in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in harm and/or the death of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), at any time from the start of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the end of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). Conversely, the answer will be negative if this situation does not take place.

An event will be classified as a 'terrorist event' if it is designated as such by any official authority of the State of France, or by the President, Prime Minister, or any member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). (2) A terrorist attack in Metropolitan France injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The attack must be described as a 'terrorist attack' by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The question will resolve as No if either or both of these conditions are not met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to take place: (a) the ICC releases arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist incident happens in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if both of the following criteria are fulfilled: (1) The International Criminal Court (ICC) must issue a warrant for the arrest of any of the following Israeli government officials: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff) before July 1, 2024. (2) A terrorist incident must occur in Metropolitan France that injures and/or results in the death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. This incident must be classified as a 'terrorist attack' by any French state agency or by the President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers of France. The resolution will be No if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for specified Israeli officials prior to July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist incident occurs in the metropolitan area of France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if both of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) The International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of these Israeli government figures: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff) before July 1, 2024. (2) A terrorist incident occurs in Metropolitan France that injures and/or results in the death of at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The event must be classified as a 'terrorist attack' by any French State agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The answer will be No if either or both of these criteria are not satisfied.

para_P.title: Are the following two occurrences expected to happen: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for certain Israeli officials before July 1, 2024, and (b) a terrorist act takes place in the metropolitan region of France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will receive a Yes response if both of the following conditions are met: (1) The International Criminal Court (ICC) issues an arrest warrant for any of the following Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff) prior to July 1, 2024. (2) A terrorist act occurs in Metropolitan France that causes injury or results in the death of at least one person, excluding the terrorist(s), between the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024) of the 2024 Summer Olympics. The incident must be recognized as a 'terrorist attack' by any French governmental agency, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers. The answer will be No if either or both of these conditions are not fulfilled.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will Trump have a lead over Biden that is greater than 2 but less than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the margin by which Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden as reported by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value indicates Trump's advantage, while a negative value suggests Biden is leading. For example, on July 5, 2024, the observed figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be understood as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will determine a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher likelihood of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the same date. In the event that Biden and Trump are shown to have equal chances, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to calculate its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a resolution based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is accessible. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest prior figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate wins will not be taken into account.

Please be aware that the resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Can both of the following scenarios occur: (a) Tim Scott is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) FiveThirtyEight shows Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The Republican National Convention selects Tim Scott as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is declared the Republican nominee on election day in 2024.

(b) As per the FiveThirtyEight election forecast dated July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is anticipated to have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election in comparison to Donald Trump. This conclusion is drawn from the data illustrated by the blue and red trend lines for that date in FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast. If Biden and Trump are depicted as having equal probabilities, the result will be regarded as a 50-50 split. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the evaluation will depend on the nearest prior data points to July 19.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling numbers between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the date of July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Will Trump have a lead over Biden of more than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the polling differences between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on July 15, 2024, with results reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative number suggests Biden is leading. For example, if on July 5, 2024, the value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to give testimony in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or via remote means, during the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value showed Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If either condition is not met, this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency through death, resignation, etc. does not qualify. Biden utilizing section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not a factor in this inquiry.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is excluded. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP lawmaker has urged Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be considered unfit under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the responsibilities and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not influence this question.

Biden's exit from the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not included.

Context: A Republican lawmaker has called on Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body:

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be explicit and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will resolve as **No**.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

For a **Yes** outcome, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should remove any chance that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the forthcoming 2024 election.

If such a definitive statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in a No answer if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, for the answer to be **Yes**, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will refuse the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden might accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s attempt to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A drafted letter, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, presents the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their colleagues remain profoundly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and, by sheer force, achieve unity, but that approach is ineffective,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter against the expedited nomination strategy is endorsed by at least 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a collective total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by the market's closing time, it will resolve to NO.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes for a generic Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, yet every other Democrat in hypothetical scenarios polls either ahead or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the overall population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second by 3% or greater at the time both polls close.

The percentage of votes for Trump is calculated using the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

These polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a typical Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas all other Democrats in similar hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the error margin. Do the Manifold participants reflect the broader public opinion?

This market will be considered YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula used is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (the Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The result is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will remain active until the specified closing time.

para_P.title: Should Donald Trump get at least 3% more backing from Manifold participants when pitted against Joe Biden rather than an average Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two surveys from Manifold, both concluding on July 6, are available. One survey asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests their choice of a standard Democrat on the same hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden lagging behind Donald Trump by a margin that exceeds the error range, while other Democrats in comparable hypothetical situations either lead or are within the error margin. Do the views of the Manifold participants align with the general public sentiment?

This market will be marked YES if Donald Trump's percentage of votes in the first survey exceeds that of the second survey by 3% or more at the conclusion of both surveys.

To determine Trump's vote percentage, the formula applied is (Trump votes / (Trump votes + (the Democrat in question) + Other votes)). The outcome is YES if the difference between the calculations for survey 1 and survey 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The surveys and this inquiry will not be resolved as N/A and will stay active until the designated closing time.

question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024 and will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body:

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) utilize Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's self-invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Background: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to utilize the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to determine Biden's incapacity before August?
para_P.body:
This will be deemed a YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to execute the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of President prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not part of this consideration. Biden's own use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican legislator has urged Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his role.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of victory over Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It may not reach a resolution until the July 20 data is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the most recent data prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they contend suppresses the vigorous ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to verify the existence of a letter.

This market will resolve to YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who are part of the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice to resolve this market to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, and will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate him early?
question.body: This question resolves YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) At 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States. (2) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to meet the second condition. If either condition is not met, this question resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024, and will there be a public letter signed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House or Senate members opposing the plan for his early nomination?

If either of these conditions is unmet, the answer to this question will be negative.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain the president, and will a minimum of 20 Democratic House or Senate members endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate him early?

(2) Before the market closes on Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public letter against the proposal for his early nomination is backed by no fewer than 20 Democratic lawmakers from either the House or Senate. Furthermore, a collection of letters that together have 20 signatures from Democratic legislators would also satisfy the second condition. If either condition is not met, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will face a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the outcome will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a **Yes** answer if the Democratic Party requires several votes during its roll call ballot to formally choose its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. On the other hand, if only one vote is needed, the response will be **No**.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmaker signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic legislators from the House or Senate publicly oppose the proposal to accelerate Biden's nomination?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Several House Democrats are collaborating on a plan to express their dissent regarding their party’s effort to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, claiming that this move stifles the essential ongoing dialogue about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain deeply worried about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to suppress debate and achieve unity through sheer force, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter is real.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement against the early nomination proposal is endorsed by no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters containing a combined total of 20 lawmaker signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by the market close, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This occurs if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. If these criteria are not met by market close, this does not occur.

Multiple letters with a total of at least 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this does not happen.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Iran's military action prior to midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran undertakes a military operation on Israeli territory, within its airspace, or in its maritime zones from July 30 to August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Conversely, it will resolve to "No" if no such action occurs.

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran against Israel's land, air, or maritime areas (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, this market will resolve to "Yes") and must be officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by credible reports. This definition encompasses, but is not limited to, aerial bombardments, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic maneuvers are excluded from this market's resolution.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be considered for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran conducts a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will resolve to "No".

In this context, a "military operation" refers to any act of force carried out by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime areas (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility on Israeli territory, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of reliable reports. This encompasses, but is not limited to, air raids, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel carried out by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this market's resolution.

para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran executes a military action on Israeli territory, in its airspace, or within its maritime limits between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will resolve to "No".

In this context, a "military action" denotes any forceful act conducted by Iran against Israeli land, airspace, or maritime regions (for instance, if an Iranian missile targets a weapons facility on Israeli soil, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or backed by a consensus of credible reports. This includes, but is not limited to, aerial strikes, naval attacks, or ground incursions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions undertaken by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory, will be counted for this market's outcome. Attacks on Israel executed by proxy organizations (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this market's resolution.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead by 2.4 points over Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden in 538's national polling average be more than 2 but not exceeding 4?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in the national polling average between Trump and Biden be greater than 2 but less than or equal to 4?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on how much Donald Trump is leading Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed in the chart for July 15, 2024, when analyzed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value indicates Trump's lead, while a negative value shows that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure showed Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which corresponds to a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if just a single ballot is sufficient, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden on that date. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its data will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It is possible that this market may not resolve until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the closest prior figures to July 19.

Please be aware that the resolution pertains to the winning odds for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate has won will not be taken into account.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?

Conversely, it will result in a "No" if Donald Trump is projected to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates are deemed to have equal probabilities, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures denoted by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its data will not impact the outcome of this market.

This market will finalize based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. It may not conclude until the figures for July 20 are accessible. If the data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities for each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The total number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will not be taken into account.

para_P.body:

In the event that both candidates are considered to have equal odds, this market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referencing the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date.
