In this scenario, a positive value indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative value shows Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump is leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight on July 19, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. It will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden according to the same source for the same date. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, it will resolve 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant data is the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and changes in methodology will not affect the resolution. If no data for July 19 is available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. The odds are reported as a number out of 100 to the 1 digit mark. (b) This question will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following conditions will happen: (a) FiveThirtyEight forecasts Joe Biden as the frontrunner against Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, and (b) on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 2 but at most 4 according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be answered with “Yes” if, according to FiveThirtyEight's election forecast for July 19, 2024, Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. Conversely, it will be marked “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher probability of winning than Joe Biden based on the same source for that date. If both candidates are seen as equally likely to win, the outcome will be 50-50. The resolution will rely on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant figures are those represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and any changes in methodology will not influence the resolution. If data for July 19 is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior data to July 19 will be utilized. The probabilities are expressed as a figure out of 100 to one decimal place. (b) This question will conclude based on whether Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive number signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) FiveThirtyEight forecasts Joe Biden as the frontrunner against Donald Trump on July 19, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden is more than 2 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will conclude with a “Yes” if the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump. Conversely, it will conclude with a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden according to the same source on the same date. Should Biden and Trump have equal probabilities, it will resolve as 50-50. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The pertinent data will be represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and any methodological changes will not influence the outcome. If data for July 19 is unavailable by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest preceding figures to July 19 will be utilized. The odds are reported as a number out of 100 to one decimal place. (b) This question will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 2 and is at most 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, while a negative figure denotes a Biden lead.

para_P.title: Will it be the case that both of the following scenarios occur: (a) On July 19, 2024, FiveThirtyEight predicts Joe Biden as the leading candidate against Donald Trump, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 2 but not exceeding 4 on July 15, 2024, according to FiveThirtyEight's national polling average?
para_P.body: (a) This question will result in a “Yes” if the FiveThirtyEight election prediction for July 19, 2024, shows that Joe Biden is more likely to win the US presidential election than Donald Trump. Conversely, it will yield a “No” if the same source indicates that Donald Trump has a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden on that date. If both candidates have equal chances, the outcome will be 50-50. The determination will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/. The relevant values will be illustrated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, and any changes in methodology will not affect the result. If the data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest available data prior to July 19 will be used. The odds are expressed as a number out of 100 to one decimal place. (b) This inquiry will resolve based on whether Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in FiveThirtyEight's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 points on the chart for July 15, 2024, as retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value signifies a Biden lead.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Francis Suarez be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently discussed; additional candidates may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it is irrelevant who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Francis Suarez going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently in discussion; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Francis Suarez be selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a response of **Yes** if Francis Suarez is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a response of **No**. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently being discussed; new candidates may arise in the future.

For the purposes of this question, the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the answer is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

This question will be marked as "No" if these criteria are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or blocked from any ballot as of July 15th, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase in support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll solicits votes from Manifold participants for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks for votes for a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public opinion frequently indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat posed in hypothetical scenarios typically leads or is within the margin of error. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks respondents to choose Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other presents a generic Democrat for selection.

Public opinion surveys have shown Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats polled hypothetically are either leading or tied within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the wider population?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time of closure for both polls.

To calculate Trump's vote percentage, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the result of this formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: Should Trump gain a minimum of 3% additional backing from Manifold respondents if he competes against Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are set to conclude on July 6. One poll inquires if respondents would select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other offers a generic Democrat for consideration.

Surveys of public sentiment indicate that Joe Biden is behind Donald Trump by a margin that exceeds the margin of error, while all other Democrats surveyed hypothetically are either ahead or tied within the margin of error. Do the Manifold respondents reflect the broader population?

This market will be considered YES if Trump's percentage of votes in the first poll is at least 3% higher than in the second poll at the time both polls close.

To determine Trump's voting percentage, apply the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result from the first poll minus the result from the second poll is equal to or greater than 0.03. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will remain open until the specified closing time and will not resolve as N/A under any circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit. Additionally, two vulnerable Democrats have informed local news outlets that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five individuals knowledgeable about the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly encourage him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request that he withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals deliver a unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should step down, it will not be adequate for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market's closing date. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If the specified conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators persuade Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news that they believe Biden's chances for a November victory are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters would request Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the situation.

This market will be resolved with a YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborates to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as signing a letter similar to what has been mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively requesting him to withdraw.

This market stipulates that all five individuals must be part of the same collective message. If five individuals separately express to the media that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In any uncertain cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a group of at least 5 specified Democratic House Members or US Senators convince Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
As reported by Politico:

Two representatives from secure districts have already made public statements urging Biden to step down. Furthermore, two of the most at-risk Democrats have conveyed to local media that they perceive Biden's chances for a victory in November as minimal.

Internally, the dynamics are even more tumultuous. Various drafts of letters are circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would solicit Biden to end his campaign, according to five sources familiar with the matter.

This market will resolve with a YES if a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators jointly requests Joe Biden to consider halting his 2024 re-election campaign, or to strongly urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter akin to what has been previously mentioned, or through another approach such as a group meeting with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

This market requires that all five individuals must convey a unified message. If five individuals independently express to the media their belief that Biden should step down, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats approaching Biden and asking him to step aside will not meet this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market closes. In any ambiguous situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will trend towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not met by July 20th, this market will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, and (2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
(1) Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat: 
There are two Manifold polls posted, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks them to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. This will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO.

(2) A group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th: 
Politico reports multiple drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one calling on Biden to end his campaign. This resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In ambiguous cases, this market will err towards resolving NO. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

According to Politico, there are several drafts of letters among House Democrats, with at least one requesting Biden to cease his campaign. All five individuals must be part of the same group communication. Five individuals separately expressing to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is inadequate for a YES resolution. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden and requesting him to step aside will not fulfill this market's requirements unless at least 5 qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the conclusion of this market. question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus preserving the largest contingent of Hungarian representatives in the European Parliament, as per reliable sources.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, and will be answered with **No** for all other possible results. In the event that two factions are equal in the number of seats, both sub-questions will be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be accessible to the general public in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the general public" means that the normal situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in some EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or not available to certain groups (such as minors), it will still resolve positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still resolve positively if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.body:

In this scenario, a positive value indicates Trump's lead, while a negative value suggests Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which is considered a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. If the election does not take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) the Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met:

1. Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that Tucker Carlson must be the candidate chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

2. A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson). Credible sources must report this victory, and in case of disagreement among popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be used to confirm the result. If no special election is held before January 1, 2025, this condition cannot be satisfied and the question is annulled.

If both conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**. If either or both are not satisfied, the answer is **No**.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(2) Joe Biden will remain president by the conclusion of July 2024: This market will affirm yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will both of the following statements hold true: (1) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (2) Joe Biden continues to serve as president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will be marked as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This inquiry is not confined to the candidates currently acknowledged; other possibilities may arise in the future. The determination is solely based on the decision made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election.

(2) Joe Biden continues to serve as president until the end of July 2024: This market will affirm yes if Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden fall between 2 and 4, based on the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as stated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which Metaculus will review on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the gap between Trump and Biden in 538's national polling average exceed 2 but not surpass 4?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in 538's national polling average between Trump and Biden be greater than 2 but less than 4?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered based on the margin favoring Donald Trump over Joe Biden as reflected in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart from July 15, 2024, as assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive value indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative value suggests Biden is ahead. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for this inquiry.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is Biden expected to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden continues to be the US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution, as the Acting President is distinct from the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Will Biden hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that time.

A temporary transfer of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution. (Acting President is not the same as President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in office as President until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States at the close of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that date.

A temporary delegation of power under the 25th amendment (like designating his Vice President as the Acting President) does not lead to a YES resolution. (An Acting President is not considered the same as the President according to the Constitution)

(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. The identity of the individual who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant. para_P.body:
(a) Biden continues to serve as the President of the United States until the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time); if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise ceases to be President before this date, the answer will be NO. A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President does not hold the same status as the President as per the Constitution).

(b) Ron DeSantis is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will yield a NO answer. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not significant. The decision is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:

If Biden takes part in another such face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve as YES. If no qualifying interview is available before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve as NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can encompass guest spots on a podcast or late-night show, or an interview that is edited into a program like 60 Minutes. However, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. A 50-minute video might only show 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, thus it would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they contend suppresses the critical ongoing discourse regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their own members remain significantly concerned about the trajectory of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden earlier?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's initiative to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and, through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm the letter’s existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by the market's closing time, this market will resolve to NO.

question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.body:

In this context, a positive figure indicates Trump's lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's advantage. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will both of the following take place: (a) On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Glenn Youngkin be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with Yes if the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4. A positive number indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative number signifies a lead for Biden.

(b) This question will be answered with Yes if Glenn Youngkin is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The outcome is determined exclusively by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the following two events take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 according to 538's national polling average, and (b) will Glenn Youngkin be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be deemed Yes if the difference in polling between Donald Trump and Joe Biden, as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is more than 3 and at most 4. A positive figure indicates Trump is ahead, while a negative one signifies Biden is in the lead.

(b) This inquiry will be deemed Yes if Glenn Youngkin is appointed by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will the following two occurrences happen on July 15, 2024: (a) will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 but less than 4 according to the national polling average from 538, and (b) will Glenn Youngkin be nominated as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This question will be answered with Yes if the polling difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden, according to 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 3 and at most 4. A positive value indicates Trump is leading, while a negative value indicates Biden is ahead.

(b) This question will be answered with Yes if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The conclusion is based exclusively on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party's attempt to finalize President Joe Biden's nomination earlier than initially scheduled, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the weekend's assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about Biden's candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by at least 20 members from the House or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' endorsements would also suffice for this market to resolve to YES.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closing time, the market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to nominate Biden prematurely?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to publicly oppose their party’s intention to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination earlier than initially scheduled, which they claim suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted and shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart approach to restrict debate and I suppose through sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it functions,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of the letter.

This market will be considered YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination initiative is signed by no less than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be adequate to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market closure, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will at least 20 Democratic lawmakers from the House or Senate sign a public letter opposing the proposal to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

A number of House Democrats are working together to publicly challenge their party’s plan to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they argue undermines the vital ongoing dialogue regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A letter prepared and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, marks the first public sign from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many within their ranks remain deeply worried about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a very unwise choice by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever strategy to limit discussion and I suppose through sheer force, achieve cohesion, but that’s not how it works,” Huffman remarked in an interview. He did not confirm the letter's existence.

Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by the market closure, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.body: This query will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is necessary, the answer will be **No**.

(b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as NO.

(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House/Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule: This will be marked as YES if a public letter against the early nomination initiative receives signatures from at least 20 members of the House or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. Multiple letters totaling 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice for this market to be marked as YES. If these conditions are not satisfied by market close, this market will be marked as NO.

(b) The Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as YES if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then this question will be marked as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the plan to virtually nominate Biden ahead of time (b) The Democrats will hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorsing a public letter against the early nomination plan: This will be considered YES if at least 20 lawmakers from the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes on Sunday, July 21st. It is also sufficient for multiple letters to total 20 signatures from lawmakers to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, the market will resolve to NO.

(b) The Democrats will conduct a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered YES if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) At least 20 Democratic legislators in the House or Senate will publicly support a letter opposing the plan to nominate Biden in advance (b) The Democratic Party will organize a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) At least 20 Democratic legislators in the House or Senate publicly supporting a letter against the early nomination plan: This will be deemed YES if a minimum of 20 Democratic lawmakers sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan prior to the market closing on Sunday, July 21st. It is also acceptable for various letters to accumulate to 20 signatures from lawmakers for this market to resolve to YES. If these requirements are not met by the market close, the market will settle on NO.

(b) The Democratic Party will hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be considered YES if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the upcoming 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is necessary, then this question will resolve to NO.

question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

Here are the CinemaScores for some of his recent films:

"Split" - B+

"Glass" - B

"Old" - C+

"Knock at the Cabin" - C

You can search the CinemaScore website for more examples.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value is Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for this question.

para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to declare that he is withdrawing from the race and stepping down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he will not pursue re-election and that he plans to resign, thereby not finishing his current term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he does not need to have officially resigned and vacated his position by the end of July. A declaration of his intention to do so will suffice for this market to resolve positively.

If he does not make these announcements, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and will also resign, thereby not fulfilling the remainder of his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time; however, it is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. An announcement expressing his plan to do so is adequate to resolve this inquiry.

If no such announcement is made, this will be marked as NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Could Joe Biden announce his decision to exit the presidential race and resign from his position before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This will be classified as a YES if Joe Biden issues a statement that he is halting his re-election campaign and will also step down from the presidency, thus not completing the remainder of his current term. Such a declaration must take place before the conclusion of July 2024, based on Pacific Time; however, it is not required for him to have formally resigned and left office by that date. A statement indicating his intention to do so is sufficient to answer this question.

If there is no such statement made, this will be recorded as NO on August 1st.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.
