question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will be deemed incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other appropriate authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enable the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is not relevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to initiate the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from the presidency.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

para_P.title: Will Biden be classified as unable to serve under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority), activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is incapable of executing the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's activation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not considered.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.body:

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Chris Christie is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This resolves as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, and (b) Chris Christie will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be considered Yes if Chris Christie is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on the election day.

para_P.title: Is it true that both of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares his refusal of the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, and (b) Chris Christie becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a declaration prior to July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, allowing no possibility for Biden to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be marked as Yes if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is announced as the Republican nominee on election day.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) Joe Biden announces his decision to decline the Democratic nomination for President before July 15, 2024, and (b) Chris Christie is selected as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden publicly announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This will be considered a Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement confirming that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unequivocal and definitive, leaving no room for Biden to accept the Democratic Party's nomination.

(b) Will Chris Christie be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?

This will be marked as Yes if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This conclusion is based on the decision made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not on who is declared as the Republican nominee on election day.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the initial domestic box office earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the total of those for "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office earnings for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) are greater than $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** as reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) exceeds $185,548,391, which represents the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the earnings from the first weekend of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be greater than the total earnings of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine**, as listed on Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceeds $185,548,391. This figure is the sum of the opening box office earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013), which are $132,434,639 and $53,113,752, respectively.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden activating section 3 of the 25th amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
The answer is YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other pertinent authority) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will be considered unable to perform his presidential responsibilities according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August?
para_P.body:
The response is YES if the Vice President, along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority), enacts Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the position of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not relevant. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

Context: A Republican lawmaker is urging Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is it possible for both of the following to happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is solely made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be acknowledged as incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant authority) invokes Section 4 to officially declare that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allow the Vice President to act as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment is also excluded.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the following two events to take place: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden is found incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is chosen by the Republican National Convention as their nominee. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving the presidency through death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not applicable.

para_P.title: Could both of the following scenarios occur: (a) Nikki Haley is selected as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election and (b) Biden is declared incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) Nikki Haley will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election if she is nominated by the Republican National Convention. This choice is solely made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

(b) Biden will be considered incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invoke Section 4 to formally declare that "the President is unable to perform the duties and responsibilities of his office" and permits the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity is not significant, and Biden's exit from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not included. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is not relevant.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his withdrawal and resignation from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. These declarations must occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time; however, he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated office by that time. A statement of his intention to resign is adequate to settle this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

It is not necessary for him to have officially resigned and left office by the end of July; an announcement of his plan to do so will suffice to resolve this market.

If he does not make such announcements, the market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

It is not required for him to have formally resigned and vacated his office by the end of July; merely announcing his intention to do so will be enough to settle this market.

If such announcements are not made, the market will conclude with a NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s plan to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, claiming it suppresses the ongoing critical discussions regarding his candidacy, as stated by a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman mentioned during an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, that would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, the market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least 3% more support from Manifold respondents?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both concluding on July 6. One poll prompts Manifold respondents to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other invites respondents to vote with a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these hypotheticals either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold respondents indicative of the broader public?

This market will resolve to YES if Donald Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more when both polls close.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the difference between the formula for poll 1 and the formula for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will remain open until the scheduled closing time regardless of circumstances.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer occurs if the result of this formula for the first poll minus the formula for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, Trump gains at least 3% among Manifold respondents (b) Kamala Harris’ VP Pick is either Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body:
(a) There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6. One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot. Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error. Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public? This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close. The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03. Otherwise, it is NO. The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

(b) The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th. This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro. This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate. I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this. Comment if you have any questions or news 💙

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly focuses on whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or prevented from any ballot as of July 15th, the inquiry will conclude negatively.

para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or disqualified from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The barring or disqualification must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible media outlets. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The answer will be "No" if these conditions are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly examines whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or disqualified from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being barred or disqualified from any ballot as of July 15th, the answer will be negative.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(1) Joe Biden must appear in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, but not press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this condition is not met.

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, this condition is not met.

Both conditions must be met for the question to resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following take place: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is eliminated or prohibited from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden needs to engage in a face-to-face interview for no less than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night television, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. There must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showcasing Biden in an in-person interview. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this condition will not be satisfied.

(2) Donald Trump must be officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be validated through formal announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then subsequently reinstated so that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or barred from any ballot, this condition will not be fulfilled.

Both conditions must be satisfied for the question to be answered as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that both of the following will happen: (1) Joe Biden participates in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either taken off or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden needs to engage in a face-to-face interview for a minimum of 45 minutes prior to the end of July 2024. This includes participation in podcasts, late-night television shows, or interviews that are edited into programs like 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be at least 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this condition is not satisfied.

(2) Donald Trump must be formally removed or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be acceptable. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or barred from any ballot, this condition is not satisfied.

Both requirements must be fulfilled for the question to be answered with YES.

para_P.title: Could it happen that both of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden takes part in an in-person interview on camera lasting more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024, and (2) Donald Trump is either removed or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(1) Joe Biden is required to participate in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024. This encompasses involvement in podcasts, late-night talk shows, or interviews that are edited into programs such as 60 Minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. There must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed face-to-face. If no qualifying interview is made public before the market closes at the end of July, this condition is not met.

(2) Donald Trump must be officially removed or prohibited from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office in line with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official announcements from state authorities, court decisions, legal documents, or credible news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be accepted. If Trump is removed or barred from a ballot and then later reinstated such that as of July 15th he is not removed or barred from any ballot, this condition is not met.

Both conditions must be satisfied for the answer to the question to be YES.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
